p.s: The given text is a speech delivered by Boris Johnson at the COP26 World Leaders Summit Opening Ceremony, on the 1st of November in 2021.
The topic of the speech is climate change and global warming.
Johnson starts his speech by welcoming the audience, then he compares the audience, including himself, to James Bond who has to switch off a bomb.
He draws a connection from the comparison to the reality and specifysspecifies that the global warming is the metaphorical bomb.
Furthermore he describes his experience in Copenhagen in 2010 and Paris in 2015 where itw as decided that the point of no return was set at 1.5 degrees.
Johnson underlines the importance of keeping this promise by drawing out the anger and impatience of the world, if this COP26 will not actually change something, concerning the climate change.
Additionally the appeal that the technology and possibility truly exists is emphasized by Johnson.
After that he repeats history that the industralized countryscountries created this problem 200 years ago.
Then he claims that they would have to solve this problem today with funds.
He emphasizes that those funds will help the rest of the world to use green technology.
According to Johnson this will only happen if the countries, especially the key countries, work together.
He explains that this will be necessary to make progress and attract private sectors, which Johnson thinks are very important.
Johnson repeats that the technology exists to perform a change, but he questions if the leaders have the necessary will to perform this change.
